content.content:
1→# repiq
     2→
     3→Fetch objective metrics for OSS repositories. Built for AI agents that need fast, non-reasoning data retrieval for library/repository selection.
     4→
     5→No judgments, no recommendations, no scores -- just numbers.
     6→
     7→## Install
     8→
     9→```
    10→go install github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/cmd/repiq@latest
    11→```
    12→
    13→## Usage
    14→
    15→```bash
    16→# Single repo (JSON output by default)
    17→repiq github:facebook/react
    18→
    19→# npm package
    20→repiq npm:react
    21→
    22→# Scoped npm package
    23→repiq npm:@types/node
    24→
    25→# Python package (PyPI)
    26→repiq pypi:requests
    27→
    28→# Rust crate (crates.io)
    29→repiq crates:serde
    30→
    31→# Go module
    32→repiq go:golang.org/x/text
    33→
    34→# Multiple targets in NDJSON
    35→repiq --ndjson github:facebook/react github:vuejs/core
    36→
    37→# Mixed providers in Markdown table
    38→repiq --markdown github:facebook/react npm:react pypi:flask crates:tokio go:golang.org/x/net
    39→
    40→# Markdown table
    41→repiq --markdown github:golang/go
    42→```
    43→
    44→## Supported Providers
    45→
    46→| Provider   | Target format              |
    47→| ---------- | -------------------------- |
    48→| GitHub     | `github:<owner>/<repo>`    |
    49→| npm        | `npm:<package>`            |
    50→| PyPI       | `pypi:<package>`           |
    51→| crates.io  | `crates:<crate>`           |
    52→| Go Modules | `go:<module>`              |
    53→
    54→## GitHub Metrics
    55→
    56→| Metric              | Description                       |
    57→| ------------------- | --------------------------------- |
    58→| `stars`             | Star count                        |
    59→| `forks`             | Fork count                        |
    60→| `open_issues`       | Open issue count (includes PRs)   |
    61→| `contributors`      | Number of contributors            |
    62→| `release_count`     | Total releases                    |
    63→| `last_commit_days`  | Days since last commit            |
    64→| `commits_30d`       | Commits in the last 30 days       |
    65→| `issues_closed_30d` | Issues closed in the last 30 days |
    66→
    67→## npm Metrics
    68→
    69→| Metric               | Description                        |
    70→| -------------------- | ---------------------------------- |
    71→| `weekly_downloads`   | Downloads in the last 7 days       |
    72→| `latest_version`     | Latest published version           |
    73→| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish            |
    74→| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies     |
    75→| `license`            | License identifier (e.g. MIT, ISC) |
    76→
    77→## PyPI Metrics
    78→
    79→| Metric               | Description                                 |
    80→| -------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |
    81→| `weekly_downloads`   | Downloads in the last 7 days                |
    82→| `monthly_downloads`  | Downloads in the last 30 days               |
    83→| `latest_version`     | Latest published version                    |
    84→| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish                     |
    85→| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies              |
    86→| `license`            | License identifier                          |
    87→| `requires_python`    | Python version requirement (e.g. `>=3.9`)   |
    88→
    89→## crates.io Metrics
    90→
    91→| Metric                  | Description                              |
    92→| ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------- |
    93→| `downloads`             | Total all-time downloads                 |
    94→| `recent_downloads`      | Downloads in the last 90 days            |
    95→| `latest_version`        | Latest stable version                    |
    96→| `last_publish_days`     | Days since last publish                  |
    97→| `dependencies_count`    | Number of normal dependencies            |
    98→| `license`               | SPDX license identifier                  |
    99→| `reverse_dependencies`  | Number of crates that depend on this one |
   100→
   101→## Go Modules Metrics
   102→
   103→| Metric               | Description                            |
   104→| -------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
   105→| `latest_version`     | Latest version tag                     |
   106→| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish                |
   107→| `dependencies_count` | Number of direct dependencies          |
   108→| `license`            | License identifier (via deps.dev)      |
   109→
   110→> Go does not provide public download count APIs. Use GitHub metrics for popularity signals.
   111→
   112→## Authentication
   113→
   114→Token resolution follows this priority (GitHub provider only):
   115→
   116→1. `gh auth token` (GitHub CLI)
   117→2. `GITHUB_TOKEN` environment variable
   118→3. Unauthenticated (lower rate limits)
   119→
   120→Other providers (npm, PyPI, crates.io, Go Modules) require no authentication.
   121→
   122→## Output Formats
   123→
   124→- `--json` (default) -- Single JSON object or array
   125→- `--ndjson` -- Newline-delimited JSON, one object per line
   126→- `--markdown` -- Markdown table
   127→
   128→## Development
   129→
   130→```bash
   131→# Enter dev environment (requires Nix)
   132→nix develop
   133→
   134→# Run tests
   135→go test ./...
   136→
   137→# Lint
   138→golangci-lint run ./...
   139→```
   140→

content.content:
1→package provider
     2→
     3→import "context"
     4→
     5→// Provider fetches metrics for a given identifier.
     6→type Provider interface {
     7→	Scheme() string
     8→	Fetch(ctx context.Context, identifier string) (Result, error)
     9→}
    10→
    11→// Result holds the output for a single target.
    12→type Result struct {
    13→	Target string         `json:"target"`
    14→	GitHub *GitHubMetrics `json:"github,omitempty"`
    15→	NPM    *NPMMetrics   `json:"npm,omitempty"`
    16→	PyPI   *PyPIMetrics   `json:"pypi,omitempty"`
    17→	Crates *CratesMetrics `json:"crates,omitempty"`
    18→	Go     *GoMetrics     `json:"go,omitempty"`
    19→	Error  string         `json:"error,omitempty"`
    20→}
    21→
    22→// NPMMetrics holds npm registry metrics.
    23→type NPMMetrics struct {
    24→	WeeklyDownloads   int    `json:"weekly_downloads"`
    25→	LatestVersion     string `json:"latest_version"`
    26→	LastPublishDays   int    `json:"last_publish_days"`
    27→	DependenciesCount int    `json:"dependencies_count"`
    28→	License           string `json:"license"`
    29→}
    30→
    31→// PyPIMetrics holds PyPI registry metrics.
    32→type PyPIMetrics struct {
    33→	WeeklyDownloads   int    `json:"weekly_downloads"`
    34→	MonthlyDownloads  int    `json:"monthly_downloads"`
    35→	LatestVersion     string `json:"latest_version"`
    36→	LastPublishDays   int    `json:"last_publish_days"`
    37→	DependenciesCount int    `json:"dependencies_count"`
    38→	License           string `json:"license"`
    39→	RequiresPython    string `json:"requires_python"`
    40→}
    41→
    42→// CratesMetrics holds crates.io registry metrics.
    43→type CratesMetrics struct {
    44→	Downloads           int    `json:"downloads"`
    45→	RecentDownloads     int    `json:"recent_downloads"`
    46→	LatestVersion       string `json:"latest_version"`
    47→	LastPublishDays     int    `json:"last_publish_days"`
    48→	DependenciesCount   int    `json:"dependencies_count"`
    49→	License             string `json:"license"`
    50→	ReverseDependencies int    `json:"reverse_dependencies"`
    51→}
    52→
    53→// GoMetrics holds Go module proxy metrics.
    54→type GoMetrics struct {
    55→	LatestVersion     string `json:"latest_version"`
    56→	LastPublishDays   int    `json:"last_publish_days"`
    57→	DependenciesCount int    `json:"dependencies_count"`
    58→	License           string `json:"license"`
    59→}
    60→
    61→// GitHubMetrics holds GitHub-specific metrics.
    62→type GitHubMetrics struct {
    63→	Stars            int `json:"stars"`
    64→	Forks            int `json:"forks"`
    65→	OpenIssues       int `json:"open_issues"`
    66→	Contributors     int `json:"contributors"`
    67→	ReleaseCount     int `json:"release_count"`
    68→	LastCommitDays   int `json:"last_commit_days"`
    69→	Commits30d       int `json:"commits_30d"`
    70→	IssuesClosed30d  int `json:"issues_closed_30d"`
    71→}
    72→

content.content:
1→package cli
     2→
     3→import (
     4→	"context"
     5→	"flag"
     6→	"fmt"
     7→	"io"
     8→	"os"
     9→	"path/filepath"
    10→	"sync"
    11→	"time"
    12→
    13→	"github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/auth"
    14→	"github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/cache"
    15→	"github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/format"
    16→	"github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider"
    17→	cratesprovider "github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider/crates"
    18→	ghprovider "github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider/github"
    19→	golangprovider "github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider/golang"
    20→	npmprovider "github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider/npm"
    21→	pypiprovider "github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider/pypi"
    22→)
    23→
    24→// Version is set at build time via ldflags.
    25→var Version = "dev"
    26→
    27→const timeout = 30 * time.Second
    28→
    29→// Run executes the CLI with the given arguments.
    30→func Run(args []string, stdout, stderr io.Writer) error {
    31→	fs := flag.NewFlagSet("repiq", flag.ContinueOnError)
    32→	fs.SetOutput(stderr)
    33→
    34→	jsonFlag := fs.Bool("json", false, "output as JSON array (default)")
    35→	ndjsonFlag := fs.Bool("ndjson", false, "output as newline-delimited JSON")
    36→	markdownFlag := fs.Bool("markdown", false, "output as Markdown table")
    37→	versionFlag := fs.Bool("version", false, "print version and exit")
    38→	noCacheFlag := fs.Bool("no-cache", false, "bypass cache and always fetch from API")
    39→
    40→	fs.Usage = func() {
    41→		_, _ = io.WriteString(stderr, `Usage: repiq [flags] <scheme>:<identifier> [...]
    42→
    43→Fetch objective metrics for OSS libraries and repositories.
    44→
    45→Examples:
    46→  repiq github:facebook/react
    47→  repiq npm:react
    48→  repiq pypi:requests
    49→  repiq crates:serde
    50→  repiq go:golang.org/x/text
    51→  repiq --ndjson github:facebook/react npm:react pypi:flask
    52→  repiq --markdown github:golang/go
    53→
    54→Flags:
    55→`)
    56→		fs.PrintDefaults()
    57→	}
    58→
    59→	if err := fs.Parse(args); err != nil {
    60→		return err
    61→	}
    62→
    63→	if *versionFlag {
    64→		_, _ = fmt.Fprintf(stdout, "repiq %s\n", Version)
    65→		return nil
    66→	}
    67→
    68→	targets := fs.Args()
    69→	if len(targets) == 0 {
    70→		fs.Usage()
    71→		return fmt.Errorf("no targets specified")
    72→	}
    73→
    74→	// Determine output format. When multiple flags are set, priority:
    75→	// markdown > ndjson > json (default). This matches the spec's
    76→	// "last specified wins" intent for wrapper scripts that set defaults.
    77→	formatter := format.JSON
    78→	if *ndjsonFlag {
    79→		formatter = format.NDJSON
    80→	}
    81→	if *markdownFlag {
    82→		formatter = format.Markdown
    83→	}
    84→	if *jsonFlag && !*ndjsonFlag && !*markdownFlag {
    85→		formatter = format.JSON
    86→	}
    87→
    88→	// Set up providers.
    89→	resolver := &auth.Resolver{
    90→		Cmd:    auth.ExecRunner{},
    91→		Getenv: os.Getenv,
    92→	}
    93→	token := resolver.ResolveToken()
    94→
    95→	registry := provider.NewRegistry()
    96→
    97→	ghProvider := provider.Provider(ghprovider.New(token, ""))
    98→	npmProvider := provider.Provider(npmprovider.New("", ""))
    99→	pypiProvider := provider.Provider(pypiprovider.New("", ""))
   100→	cratesProvider := provider.Provider(cratesprovider.New(""))
   101→	goProvider := provider.Provider(golangprovider.New("", ""))
   102→
   103→	if cacheDir, err := os.UserCacheDir(); err == nil {
   104→		store := cache.NewStore(filepath.Join(cacheDir, "repiq"), 24*time.Hour)
   105→		ghProvider = cache.NewProvider(ghProvider, store, *noCacheFlag)
   106→		npmProvider = cache.NewProvider(npmProvider, store, *noCacheFlag)
   107→		pypiProvider = cache.NewProvider(pypiProvider, store, *noCacheFlag)
   108→		cratesProvider = cache.NewProvider(cratesProvider, store, *noCacheFlag)
   109→		goProvider = cache.NewProvider(goProvider, store, *noCacheFlag)
   110→	}
   111→
   112→	registry.Register(ghProvider)
   113→	registry.Register(npmProvider)
   114→	registry.Register(pypiProvider)
   115→	registry.Register(cratesProvider)
   116→	registry.Register(goProvider)
   117→
   118→	// Parse and validate all targets first.
   119→	parsed := make([]provider.Target, len(targets))
   120→	for i, raw := range targets {
   121→		t, err := provider.ParseTarget(raw)
   122→		if err != nil {
   123→			return err
   124→		}
   125→		if _, ok := registry.Lookup(t.Scheme); !ok {
   126→			return fmt.Errorf("unknown scheme %q in target %q", t.Scheme, raw)
   127→		}
   128→		parsed[i] = t
   129→	}
   130→
   131→	// Fetch all targets in parallel.
   132→	ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(context.Background(), timeout)
   133→	defer cancel()
   134→
   135→	results := make([]provider.Result, len(parsed))
   136→	var wg sync.WaitGroup
   137→	wg.Add(len(parsed))
   138→	for i, t := range parsed {
   139→		go func(i int, t provider.Target) {
   140→			defer wg.Done()
   141→			p, _ := registry.Lookup(t.Scheme)
   142→			result, err := p.Fetch(ctx, t.Identifier)
   143→			if err != nil {
   144→				results[i] = provider.Result{
   145→					Target: t.Scheme + ":" + t.Identifier,
   146→					Error:  err.Error(),
   147→				}
   148→				return
   149→			}
   150→			results[i] = result
   151→		}(i, t)
   152→	}
   153→	wg.Wait()
   154→
   155→	// Output results.
   156→	if err := formatter(stdout, results); err != nil {
   157→		return fmt.Errorf("formatting output: %w", err)
   158→	}
   159→
   160→	// Exit code: 1 if any result has an error.
   161→	for _, r := range results {
   162→		if r.Error != "" {
   163→			return fmt.Errorf("one or more targets failed")
   164→		}
   165→	}
   166→	return nil
   167→}
   168→

content.text:
全情報が揃いました。実装計画を提示します。

---

## Implementation Plan: Agent Skills SKILL.md

### Architecture Review

**影響ファイル:**
- `skills/repiq/SKILL.md` (新規作成)
- `skills/repiq/references/REFERENCE.md` (新規作成)
- `README.md` (Agent Skills セクション追加)

**コード変更なし** — docs-only のフィーチャー。

### Phase Breakdown

```
Phase 1: [#1 REFERENCE.md] ─── [#2 SKILL.md]
                                     │
Phase 2: [#3 README.md] ────────────┘
                                     │
Phase 3: [#4 Validate] ─────────────┘
```

- #1 と #2 は並列可能 (別ファイル、SKILL.md は相対パスで参照するだけ)
- #3 は #1/#2 完了後 (Agent Skills セクションに SKILL.md の存在を前提とした記述)
- #4 は全ファイル完成後にバリデーション

### Risk Assessment

| Risk | Level | Mitigation |
|------|-------|------------|
| skills-ref validate が通らない | LOW | 仕様を事前調査済み、frontmatter フォーマット確定済み |
| npx skills add が検出しない | LOW | anthropics/skills リポジトリと同じ構造を採用 |
| SKILL.md が 500 行超過 | LOW | REFERENCE.md に分離済み |

### Tasks

**#1 — Create REFERENCE.md (詳細出力スキーマ)**
- What: 5 プロバイダーの全メトリクスフィールドを Markdown テーブルで記載
- Where: `skills/repiq/references/REFERENCE.md` (新規)

content.content:
1→# repiq
     2→
     3→Fetch objective metrics for OSS repositories. Built for AI agents that need fast, non-reasoning data retrieval for library/repository selection.
     4→
     5→No judgments, no recommendations, no scores -- just numbers.
     6→
     7→## Install
     8→
     9→```
    10→go install github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/cmd/repiq@latest
    11→```
    12→
    13→## Usage
    14→
    15→```bash
    16→# Single repo (JSON output by default)
    17→repiq github:facebook/react
    18→
    19→# npm package
    20→repiq npm:react
    21→
    22→# Scoped npm package
    23→repiq npm:@types/node
    24→
    25→# Python package (PyPI)
    26→repiq pypi:requests
    27→
    28→# Rust crate (crates.io)
    29→repiq crates:serde
    30→
    31→# Go module
    32→repiq go:golang.org/x/text
    33→
    34→# Multiple targets in NDJSON
    35→repiq --ndjson github:facebook/react github:vuejs/core
    36→

file.content:
# repiq

Fetch objective metrics for OSS repositories. Built for AI agents that need fast, non-reasoning data retrieval for library/repository selection.

No judgments, no recommendations, no scores -- just numbers.

## Install

```
go install github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/cmd/repiq@latest
```

## Usage

```bash
# Single repo (JSON output by default)
repiq github:facebook/react

# npm package
repiq npm:react

# Scoped npm package
repiq npm:@types/node

# Python package (PyPI)
repiq pypi:requests

# Rust crate (crates.io)
repiq crates:serde

# Go module
repiq go:golang.org/x/text

# Multiple targets in NDJSON
repiq --ndjson github:facebook/react github:vuejs/core

# Mixed providers in Markdown table
repiq --markdown github:facebook/react npm:react pypi:flask crates:tokio go:golang.org/x/net

# Markdown table
repiq --markdown github:golang/go
```

## Supported Providers

| Provider   | Target format              |
| ---------- | -------------------------- |
| GitHub     | `github:<owner>/<repo>`    |
| npm        | `npm:<package>`            |
| PyPI       | `pypi:<package>`           |
| crates.io  | `crates:<crate>`           |
| Go Modules | `go:<module>`              |

## GitHub Metrics

| Metric              | Description                       |
| ------------------- | --------------------------------- |
| `stars`             | Star count                        |
| `forks`             | Fork count                        |
| `open_issues`       | Open issue count (includes PRs)   |
| `contributors`      | Number of contributors            |
| `release_count`     | Total releases                    |
| `last_commit_days`  | Days since last commit            |
| `commits_30d`       | Commits in the last 30 days       |
| `issues_closed_30d` | Issues closed in the last 30 days |

## npm Metrics

| Metric               | Description                        |
| -------------------- | ---------------------------------- |
| `weekly_downloads`   | Downloads in the last 7 days       |
| `latest_version`     | Latest published version           |
| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish            |
| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies     |
| `license`            | License identifier (e.g. MIT, ISC) |

## PyPI Metrics

| Metric               | Description                                 |
| -------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |
| `weekly_downloads`   | Downloads in the last 7 days                |
| `monthly_downloads`  | Downloads in the last 30 days               |
| `latest_version`     | Latest published version                    |
| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish                     |
| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies              |
| `license`            | License identifier                          |
| `requires_python`    | Python version requirement (e.g. `>=3.9`)   |

## crates.io Metrics

| Metric                  | Description                              |
| ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------- |
| `downloads`             | Total all-time downloads                 |
| `recent_downloads`      | Downloads in the last 90 days            |
| `latest_version`        | Latest stable version                    |
| `last_publish_days`     | Days since last publish                  |
| `dependencies_count`    | Number of normal dependencies            |
| `license`               | SPDX license identifier                  |
| `reverse_dependencies`  | Number of crates that depend on this one |

## Go Modules Metrics

| Metric               | Description                            |
| -------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
| `latest_version`     | Latest version tag                     |
| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish                |
| `dependencies_count` | Number of direct dependencies          |
| `license`            | License identifier (via deps.dev)      |

> Go does not provide public download count APIs. Use GitHub metrics for popularity signals.

## Authentication

Token resolution follows this priority (GitHub provider only):

1. `gh auth token` (GitHub CLI)
2. `GITHUB_TOKEN` environment variable
3. Unauthenticated (lower rate limits)

Other providers (npm, PyPI, crates.io, Go Modules) require no authentication.

## Output Formats

- `--json` (default) -- Single JSON object or array
- `--ndjson` -- Newline-delimited JSON, one object per line
- `--markdown` -- Markdown table

## Development

```bash
# Enter dev environment (requires Nix)
nix develop

# Run tests
go test ./...

# Lint
golangci-lint run ./...
```

1→package provider
     2→
     3→import "context"
     4→
     5→// Provider fetches metrics for a given identifier.
     6→type Provider interface {
     7→	Scheme() string
     8→	Fetch(ctx context.Context, identifier string) (Result, error)
     9→}
    10→
    11→// Result holds the output for a single target.
    12→type Result struct {
    13→	Target string         `json:"target"`
    14→	GitHub *GitHubMetrics `json:"github,omitempty"`
    15→	NPM    *NPMMetrics   `json:"npm,omitempty"`
    16→	PyPI   *PyPIMetrics   `json:"pypi,omitempty"`
    17→	Crates *CratesMetrics `json:"crates,omitempty"`
    18→	Go     *GoMetrics     `json:"go,omitempty"`
    19→	Error  string         `json:"error,omitempty"`
    20→}
    21→
    22→// NPMMetrics holds npm registry metrics.
    23→type NPMMetrics struct {
    24→	WeeklyDownloads   int    `json:"weekly_downloads"`
    25→	LatestVersion     string `json:"latest_version"`
    26→	LastPublishDays   int    `json:"last_publish_days"`
    27→	DependenciesCount int    `json:"dependencies_count"`
    28→	License           string `json:"license"`
    29→}
    30→
    31→// PyPIMetrics holds PyPI registry metrics.
    32→type PyPIMetrics struct {
    33→	WeeklyDownloads   int    `json:"weekly_downloads"`
    34→	MonthlyDownloads  int    `json:"monthly_downloads"`
    35→	LatestVersion     string `json:"latest_version"`
    36→	LastPublishDays   int    `json:"last_publish_days"`
    37→	DependenciesCount int    `json:"dependencies_count"`
    38→	License           string `json:"license"`
    39→	RequiresPython    string `json:"requires_python"`
    40→}
    41→
    42→// CratesMetrics holds crates.io registry metrics.
    43→type CratesMetrics struct {
    44→	Downloads           int    `json:"downloads"`
    45→	RecentDownloads     int    `json:"recent_downloads"`
    46→	LatestVersion       string `json:"latest_version"`
    47→	LastPublishDays     int    `json:"last_publish_days"`
    48→	DependenciesCount   int    `json:"dependencies_count"`
    49→	License             string `json:"license"`
    50→	ReverseDependencies int    `json:"reverse_dependencies"`
    51→}
    52→
    53→// GoMetrics holds Go module proxy metrics.
    54→type GoMetrics struct {
    55→	LatestVersion     string `json:"latest_version"`
    56→	LastPublishDays   int    `json:"last_publish_days"`
    57→	DependenciesCount int    `json:"dependencies_count"`
    58→	License           string `json:"license"`
    59→}
    60→
    61→// GitHubMetrics holds GitHub-specific metrics.
    62→type GitHubMetrics struct {
    63→	Stars            int `json:"stars"`
    64→	Forks            int `json:"forks"`
    65→	OpenIssues       int `json:"open_issues"`
    66→	Contributors     int `json:"contributors"`
    67→	ReleaseCount     int `json:"release_count"`
    68→	LastCommitDays   int `json:"last_commit_days"`
    69→	Commits30d       int `json:"commits_30d"`
    70→	IssuesClosed30d  int `json:"issues_closed_30d"`
    71→}
    72→

1→package cli
     2→
     3→import (
     4→	"context"
     5→	"flag"
     6→	"fmt"
     7→	"io"
     8→	"os"
     9→	"path/filepath"
    10→	"sync"
    11→	"time"
    12→
    13→	"github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/auth"
    14→	"github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/cache"
    15→	"github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/format"
    16→	"github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider"
    17→	cratesprovider "github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider/crates"
    18→	ghprovider "github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider/github"
    19→	golangprovider "github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider/golang"
    20→	npmprovider "github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider/npm"
    21→	pypiprovider "github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/internal/provider/pypi"
    22→)
    23→
    24→// Version is set at build time via ldflags.
    25→var Version = "dev"
    26→
    27→const timeout = 30 * time.Second
    28→
    29→// Run executes the CLI with the given arguments.
    30→func Run(args []string, stdout, stderr io.Writer) error {
    31→	fs := flag.NewFlagSet("repiq", flag.ContinueOnError)
    32→	fs.SetOutput(stderr)
    33→
    34→	jsonFlag := fs.Bool("json", false, "output as JSON array (default)")
    35→	ndjsonFlag := fs.Bool("ndjson", false, "output as newline-delimited JSON")
    36→	markdownFlag := fs.Bool("markdown", false, "output as Markdown table")
    37→	versionFlag := fs.Bool("version", false, "print version and exit")
    38→	noCacheFlag := fs.Bool("no-cache", false, "bypass cache and always fetch from API")
    39→
    40→	fs.Usage = func() {
    41→		_, _ = io.WriteString(stderr, `Usage: repiq [flags] <scheme>:<identifier> [...]
    42→
    43→Fetch objective metrics for OSS libraries and repositories.
    44→
    45→Examples:
    46→  repiq github:facebook/react
    47→  repiq npm:react
    48→  repiq pypi:requests
    49→  repiq crates:serde
    50→  repiq go:golang.org/x/text
    51→  repiq --ndjson github:facebook/react npm:react pypi:flask
    52→  repiq --markdown github:golang/go
    53→
    54→Flags:
    55→`)
    56→		fs.PrintDefaults()
    57→	}
    58→
    59→	if err := fs.Parse(args); err != nil {
    60→		return err
    61→	}
    62→
    63→	if *versionFlag {
    64→		_, _ = fmt.Fprintf(stdout, "repiq %s\n", Version)
    65→		return nil
    66→	}
    67→
    68→	targets := fs.Args()
    69→	if len(targets) == 0 {
    70→		fs.Usage()
    71→		return fmt.Errorf("no targets specified")
    72→	}
    73→
    74→	// Determine output format. When multiple flags are set, priority:
    75→	// markdown > ndjson > json (default). This matches the spec's
    76→	// "last specified wins" intent for wrapper scripts that set defaults.
    77→	formatter := format.JSON
    78→	if *ndjsonFlag {
    79→		formatter = format.NDJSON
    80→	}
    81→	if *markdownFlag {
    82→		formatter = format.Markdown
    83→	}
    84→	if *jsonFlag && !*ndjsonFlag && !*markdownFlag {
    85→		formatter = format.JSON
    86→	}
    87→
    88→	// Set up providers.
    89→	resolver := &auth.Resolver{
    90→		Cmd:    auth.ExecRunner{},
    91→		Getenv: os.Getenv,
    92→	}
    93→	token := resolver.ResolveToken()
    94→
    95→	registry := provider.NewRegistry()
    96→
    97→	ghProvider := provider.Provider(ghprovider.New(token, ""))
    98→	npmProvider := provider.Provider(npmprovider.New("", ""))
    99→	pypiProvider := provider.Provider(pypiprovider.New("", ""))
   100→	cratesProvider := provider.Provider(cratesprovider.New(""))
   101→	goProvider := provider.Provider(golangprovider.New("", ""))
   102→
   103→	if cacheDir, err := os.UserCacheDir(); err == nil {
   104→		store := cache.NewStore(filepath.Join(cacheDir, "repiq"), 24*time.Hour)
   105→		ghProvider = cache.NewProvider(ghProvider, store, *noCacheFlag)
   106→		npmProvider = cache.NewProvider(npmProvider, store, *noCacheFlag)
   107→		pypiProvider = cache.NewProvider(pypiProvider, store, *noCacheFlag)
   108→		cratesProvider = cache.NewProvider(cratesProvider, store, *noCacheFlag)
   109→		goProvider = cache.NewProvider(goProvider, store, *noCacheFlag)
   110→	}
   111→
   112→	registry.Register(ghProvider)
   113→	registry.Register(npmProvider)
   114→	registry.Register(pypiProvider)
   115→	registry.Register(cratesProvider)
   116→	registry.Register(goProvider)
   117→
   118→	// Parse and validate all targets first.
   119→	parsed := make([]provider.Target, len(targets))
   120→	for i, raw := range targets {
   121→		t, err := provider.ParseTarget(raw)
   122→		if err != nil {
   123→			return err
   124→		}
   125→		if _, ok := registry.Lookup(t.Scheme); !ok {
   126→			return fmt.Errorf("unknown scheme %q in target %q", t.Scheme, raw)
   127→		}
   128→		parsed[i] = t
   129→	}
   130→
   131→	// Fetch all targets in parallel.
   132→	ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(context.Background(), timeout)
   133→	defer cancel()
   134→
   135→	results := make([]provider.Result, len(parsed))
   136→	var wg sync.WaitGroup
   137→	wg.Add(len(parsed))
   138→	for i, t := range parsed {
   139→		go func(i int, t provider.Target) {
   140→			defer wg.Done()
   141→			p, _ := registry.Lookup(t.Scheme)
   142→			result, err := p.Fetch(ctx, t.Identifier)
   143→			if err != nil {
   144→				results[i] = provider.Result{
   145→					Target: t.Scheme + ":" + t.Identifier,
   146→					Error:  err.Error(),
   147→				}
   148→				return
   149→			}
   150→			results[i] = result
   151→		}(i, t)
   152→	}
   153→	wg.Wait()
   154→
   155→	// Output results.
   156→	if err := formatter(stdout, results); err != nil {
   157→		return fmt.Errorf("formatting output: %w", err)
   158→	}
   159→
   160→	// Exit code: 1 if any result has an error.
   161→	for _, r := range results {
   162→		if r.Error != "" {
   163→			return fmt.Errorf("one or more targets failed")
   164→		}
   165→	}
   166→	return nil
   167→}
   168→

input.content:
# repiq Output Reference

Detailed JSON output schema for each provider. See [SKILL.md](../SKILL.md) for usage instructions.

## Result Structure

Each target produces a `Result` object:

```json
{
  "target": "scheme:identifier",
  "github": { ... },
  "npm": { ... },
  "pypi": { ... },
  "crates": { ... },
  "go": { ... },
  "error": "error message if failed"
}
```

- Only the matching provider field is populated per result.
- `error` is present only when the fetch failed. Partial results may include both metrics and an error.

## GitHub Metrics

JSON key: `github`

| Field | Type | JSON Key | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| Stars | int | `stars` | Total star count |
| Forks | int | `forks` | Total fork count |
| Open Issues | int | `open_issues` | Open issue count (includes pull requests per GitHub API) |
| Contributors | int | `contributors` | Number of contributors |
| Release Count | int | `release_count` | Total number of releases |
| Last Commit Days | int | `last_commit_days` | Days since the most recent commit |
| Commits 30d | int | `commits_30d` | Number of commits in the last 30 days |
| Issues Closed 30d | int | `issues_closed_30d` | Number of issues closed in the last 30 days |

## npm Metrics

JSON key: `npm`

| Field | Type | JSON Key | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| Weekly Downloads | int | `weekly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 7 days |
| Latest Version | string | `latest_version` | Latest published version |
| Last Publish Days | int | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish |
| Dependencies Count | int | `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies |
| License | string | `license` | SPDX license identifier (e.g. MIT, ISC) |

## PyPI Metrics

JSON key: `pypi`

| Field | Type | JSON Key | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| Weekly Downloads | int | `weekly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 7 days |
| Monthly Downloads | int | `monthly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 30 days |
| Latest Version | string | `latest_version` | Latest published version |
| Last Publish Days | int | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish |
| Dependencies Count | int | `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies |
| License | string | `license` | SPDX license identifier |
| Requires Python | string | `requires_python` | Minimum Python version (e.g. `>=3.9`) |

## crates.io Metrics

JSON key: `crates`

| Field | Type | JSON Key | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| Downloads | int | `downloads` | Total all-time downloads |
| Recent Downloads | int | `recent_downloads` | Downloads in the last 90 days |
| Latest Version | string | `latest_version` | Latest stable version |
| Last Publish Days | int | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish |
| Dependencies Count | int | `dependencies_count` | Number of normal dependencies |
| License | string | `license` | SPDX license identifier |
| Reverse Dependencies | int | `reverse_dependencies` | Number of crates that depend on this one |

## Go Modules Metrics

JSON key: `go`

| Field | Type | JSON Key | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| Latest Version | string | `latest_version` | Latest version tag |
| Last Publish Days | int | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish |
| Dependencies Count | int | `dependencies_count` | Number of direct dependencies |
| License | string | `license` | SPDX license identifier (via deps.dev) |

> Go does not provide public download count APIs. Use GitHub metrics for popularity signals.

## Output Formats

### JSON (default)

Single JSON array. Each element is a Result object.

```bash
repiq github:facebook/react npm:react
```

```json
[
  {
    "target": "github:facebook/react",
    "github": {
      "stars": 234000,
      "forks": 47000,
      "open_issues": 1000,
      "contributors": 1700,
      "release_count": 220,
      "last_commit_days": 0,
      "commits_30d": 80,
      "issues_closed_30d": 150
    }
  },
  {
    "target": "npm:react",
    "npm": {
      "weekly_downloads": 28000000,
      "latest_version": "19.1.0",
      "last_publish_days": 10,
      "dependencies_count": 0,
      "license": "MIT"
    }
  }
]
```

### NDJSON (`--ndjson`)

One JSON object per line, no array wrapper.

```bash
repiq --ndjson github:facebook/react npm:react
```

```
{"target":"github:facebook/react","github":{"stars":234000,...}}
{"target":"npm:react","npm":{"weekly_downloads":28000000,...}}
```

### Markdown (`--markdown`)

Provider-grouped tables.

```bash
repiq --markdown github:facebook/react npm:react
```

```markdown
| target | stars | forks | open_issues | contributors | release_count | last_commit_days | commits_30d | issues_closed_30d |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| github:facebook/react | 234000 | 47000 | 1000 | 1700 | 220 | 0 | 80 | 150 |

| target | weekly_downloads | latest_version | last_publish_days | dependencies_count | license |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| npm:react | 28000000 | 19.1.0 | 10 | 0 | MIT |
```

## Error Handling

When a target fails, the result contains only `target` and `error`:

```json
{
  "target": "github:nonexistent/repo",
  "error": "GitHub API: 404 Not Found"
}
```

- Partial failures are possible: successful targets return metrics even if other targets fail.
- The CLI exits with code 1 if any target has an error.

| Stars | int | `stars` | Total star count |
| Forks | int | `forks` | Total fork count |
| Open Issues | int | `open_issues` | Open issue count (includes pull requests per GitHub API) |
| Contributors | int | `contributors` | Number of contributors |
| Release Count | int | `release_count` | Total number of releases |
| Last Commit Days | int | `last_commit_days` | Days since the most recent commit |
| Commits 30d | int | `commits_30d` | Number of commits in the last 30 days |
| Issues Closed 30d | int | `issues_closed_30d` | Number of issues closed in the last 30 days |

## npm Metrics

JSON key: `npm`

| Field | Type | JSON Key | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| Weekly Downloads | int | `weekly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 7 days |
| Latest Version | string | `latest_version` | Latest published version |
| Last Publish Days | int | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish |
| Dependencies Count | int | `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies |
| License | string | `license` | SPDX license identifier (e.g. MIT, ISC) |

## PyPI Metrics

JSON key: `pypi`

| Field | Type | JSON Key | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| Weekly Downloads | int | `weekly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 7 days |
| Monthly Downloads | int | `monthly_downloads` | Downloads in the last 30 days |
| Latest Version | string | `latest_version` | Latest published version |
| Last Publish Days | int | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish |
| Dependencies Count | int | `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies |
| License | string | `license` | SPDX license identifier |
| Requires Python | string | `requires_python` | Minimum Python version (e.g. `>=3.9`) |

## crates.io Metrics

JSON key: `crates`

| Field | Type | JSON Key | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| Downloads | int | `downloads` | Total all-time downloads |
| Recent Downloads | int | `recent_downloads` | Downloads in the last 90 days |
| Latest Version | string | `latest_version` | Latest stable version |
| Last Publish Days | int | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish |
| Dependencies Count | int | `dependencies_count` | Number of normal dependencies |
| License | string | `license` | SPDX license identifier |
| Reverse Dependencies | int | `reverse_dependencies` | Number of crates that depend on this one |

## Go Modules Metrics

JSON key: `go`

| Field | Type | JSON Key | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| Latest Version | string | `latest_version` | Latest version tag |
| Last Publish Days | int | `last_publish_days` | Days since last publish |
| Dependencies Count | int | `dependencies_count` | Number of direct dependencies |
| License | string | `license` | SPDX license identifier (via deps.dev) |

> Go does not provide public download count APIs. Use GitHub metrics for popularity signals.

## Output Formats

### JSON (default)

Single JSON array. Each element is a Result object.

```bash
repiq github:facebook/react npm:react
```

```json
[
  {
    "target": "github:facebook/react",
    "github": {
      "stars": 234000,
      "forks": 47000,
      "open_issues": 1000,
      "contributors": 1700,
      "release_count": 220,
      "last_commit_days": 0,
      "commits_30d": 80,
      "issues_closed_30d": 150
    }
  },
  {
    "target": "npm:react",
    "npm": {
      "weekly_downloads": 28000000,
      "latest_version": "19.1.0",
      "last_publish_days": 10,
      "dependencies_count": 0,
      "license": "MIT"
    }
  }
]
```

### NDJSON (`--ndjson`)

One JSON object per line, no array wrapper.

```bash
repiq --ndjson github:facebook/react npm:react
```

```
{"target":"github:facebook/react","github":{"stars":234000,...}}
{"target":"npm:react","npm":{"weekly_downloads":28000000,...}}
```

### Markdown (`--markdown`)

Provider-grouped tables.

```bash
repiq --markdown github:facebook/react npm:react
```

```markdown
| target | stars | forks | open_issues | contributors | release_count | last_commit_days | commits_30d | issues_closed_30d |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| github:facebook/react | 234000 | 47000 | 1000 | 1700 | 220 | 0 | 80 | 150 |

| target | weekly_downloads | latest_version | last_publish_days | dependencies_count | license |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| npm:react | 28000000 | 19.1.0 | 10 | 0 | MIT |
```

## Error Handling

When a target fails, the result contains only `target` and `error`:

```json
{
  "target": "github:nonexistent/repo",
  "error": "GitHub API: 404 Not Found"
}
```

- Partial failures are possible: successful targets return metrics even if other targets fail.
- The CLI exits with code 1 if any target has an error.

input.content:
---
name: repiq
description: >-
  Fetch objective metrics for OSS repositories and packages.
  Use when evaluating, comparing, or selecting libraries and repositories.
  Supports GitHub repos, npm/PyPI/crates.io packages, and Go modules.
  Returns stars, downloads, contributors, release activity, and more as structured JSON.
  No judgments, no recommendations, no scores — just numbers.
license: MIT
compatibility: Requires repiq CLI installed in PATH. Install via `go install` or Nix flake.
metadata:
  author: yutakobayashidev
  version: "1.0"
---

# repiq

Fetch objective metrics for OSS repositories and packages. Built for AI agents that need fast, non-reasoning data retrieval for library and repository evaluation.

**Role separation:** repiq provides raw data. You (the agent) do the reasoning. The human makes the final decision.

## Quick Start

```bash
# Fetch GitHub repo metrics
repiq github:facebook/react

# Fetch npm package metrics
repiq npm:react

# Compare multiple targets across providers
repiq --json github:facebook/react npm:react pypi:flask crates:serde go:golang.org/x/net
```

Output is JSON by default. Each target returns a structured result with provider-specific metrics.

## Supported Schemes

| Scheme | Format | Example |
|--------|--------|---------|
| GitHub | `github:<owner>/<repo>` | `github:facebook/react` |
| npm | `npm:<package>` | `npm:react`, `npm:@types/node` |
| PyPI | `pypi:<package>` | `pypi:requests` |
| crates.io | `crates:<crate>` | `crates:serde` |
| Go Modules | `go:<module/path>` | `go:golang.org/x/net` |

Multiple targets can be passed in a single command. They are fetched in parallel.

## Flags

| Flag | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `--json` | Output as JSON array (default) |
| `--ndjson` | Output as newline-delimited JSON (one object per line) |
| `--markdown` | Output as Markdown tables (grouped by provider) |
| `--no-cache` | Bypass 24-hour disk cache and always fetch from API |
| `--version` | Print version and exit |

## Key Metrics by Provider

**GitHub** (8 metrics): `stars`, `forks`, `open_issues`, `contributors`, `release_count`, `last_commit_days`, `commits_30d`, `issues_closed_30d`

**npm** (5 metrics): `weekly_downloads`, `latest_version`, `last_publish_days`, `dependencies_count`, `license`

**PyPI** (7 metrics): `weekly_downloads`, `monthly_downloads`, `latest_version`, `last_publish_days`, `dependencies_count`, `license`, `requires_python`

**crates.io** (7 metrics): `downloads`, `recent_downloads`, `latest_version`, `last_publish_days`, `dependencies_count`, `license`, `reverse_dependencies`

**Go Modules** (4 metrics): `latest_version`, `last_publish_days`, `dependencies_count`, `license`

For full field descriptions and types, see [references/REFERENCE.md](./references/REFERENCE.md).

## Use Cases

### Compare libraries for the same task

```bash
repiq --json github:expressjs/express github:fastify/fastify npm:express npm:fastify
```

Compare `stars`, `commits_30d`, `weekly_downloads`, and `last_publish_days` to assess activity and adoption.

### Evaluate repository health

```bash
repiq github:some-org/some-repo
```

Check `last_commit_days` (is it maintained?), `issues_closed_30d` (is the team responsive?), and `contributors` (bus factor).

### Cross-ecosystem package comparison

```bash
repiq npm:zod pypi:pydantic crates:serde
```

Compare equivalent packages across language ecosystems using `weekly_downloads`, `dependencies_count`, and `license`.

## Authentication

**GitHub only.** Token is resolved automatically:

1. `gh auth token` (GitHub CLI — recommended)
2. `GITHUB_TOKEN` environment variable
3. Unauthenticated (60 req/hour rate limit)

Authenticated requests get 5,000 req/hour. Other providers require no authentication.

## Installation

```bash
# Go install
go install github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/cmd/repiq@latest

# Or use Nix flake
nix run github:yutakobayashidev/repiq
```

Verify installation:

```bash
repiq --version
```

## Caching

Results are cached on disk for 24 hours at `$XDG_CACHE_HOME/repiq/` (typically `~/.cache/repiq/`).

Use `--no-cache` to bypass cache reads (writes still occur for subsequent runs).

## Error Handling

- Failed targets return `{"target": "...", "error": "..."}` — other targets still succeed.
- Exit code is 1 if any target fails, 0 if all succeed.
- Common errors: 404 (not found), rate limit exceeded, network timeout (30s).

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# repiq

Fetch objective metrics for OSS repositories. Built for AI agents that need fast, non-reasoning data retrieval for library/repository selection.

No judgments, no recommendations, no scores -- just numbers.

## Install

```
go install github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/cmd/repiq@latest
```

## Usage

```bash
# Single repo (JSON output by default)
repiq github:facebook/react

# npm package
repiq npm:react

# Scoped npm package
repiq npm:@types/node

# Python package (PyPI)
repiq pypi:requests

# Rust crate (crates.io)
repiq crates:serde

# Go module
repiq go:golang.org/x/text

# Multiple targets in NDJSON
repiq --ndjson github:facebook/react github:vuejs/core

# Mixed providers in Markdown table
repiq --markdown github:facebook/react npm:react pypi:flask crates:tokio go:golang.org/x/net

# Markdown table
repiq --markdown github:golang/go
```

## Supported Providers

| Provider   | Target format              |
| ---------- | -------------------------- |
| GitHub     | `github:<owner>/<repo>`    |
| npm        | `npm:<package>`            |
| PyPI       | `pypi:<package>`           |
| crates.io  | `crates:<crate>`           |
| Go Modules | `go:<module>`              |

## GitHub Metrics

| Metric              | Description                       |
| ------------------- | --------------------------------- |
| `stars`             | Star count                        |
| `forks`             | Fork count                        |
| `open_issues`       | Open issue count (includes PRs)   |
| `contributors`      | Number of contributors            |
| `release_count`     | Total releases                    |
| `last_commit_days`  | Days since last commit            |
| `commits_30d`       | Commits in the last 30 days       |
| `issues_closed_30d` | Issues closed in the last 30 days |

## npm Metrics

| Metric               | Description                        |
| -------------------- | ---------------------------------- |
| `weekly_downloads`   | Downloads in the last 7 days       |
| `latest_version`     | Latest published version           |
| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish            |
| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies     |
| `license`            | License identifier (e.g. MIT, ISC) |

## PyPI Metrics

| Metric               | Description                                 |
| -------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |
| `weekly_downloads`   | Downloads in the last 7 days                |
| `monthly_downloads`  | Downloads in the last 30 days               |
| `latest_version`     | Latest published version                    |
| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish                     |
| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies              |
| `license`            | License identifier                          |
| `requires_python`    | Python version requirement (e.g. `>=3.9`)   |

## crates.io Metrics

| Metric                  | Description                              |
| ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------- |
| `downloads`             | Total all-time downloads                 |
| `recent_downloads`      | Downloads in the last 90 days            |
| `latest_version`        | Latest stable version                    |
| `last_publish_days`     | Days since last publish                  |
| `dependencies_count`    | Number of normal dependencies            |
| `license`               | SPDX license identifier                  |
| `reverse_dependencies`  | Number of crates that depend on this one |

## Go Modules Metrics

| Metric               | Description                            |
| -------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
| `latest_version`     | Latest version tag                     |
| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish                |
| `dependencies_count` | Number of direct dependencies          |
| `license`            | License identifier (via deps.dev)      |

> Go does not provide public download count APIs. Use GitHub metrics for popularity signals.

## Authentication

Token resolution follows this priority (GitHub provider only):

1. `gh auth token` (GitHub CLI)
2. `GITHUB_TOKEN` environment variable
3. Unauthenticated (lower rate limits)

Other providers (npm, PyPI, crates.io, Go Modules) require no authentication.

## Output Formats

- `--json` (default) -- Single JSON object or array
- `--ndjson` -- Newline-delimited JSON, one object per line
- `--markdown` -- Markdown table

## Development

```bash
# Enter dev environment (requires Nix)
nix develop

# Run tests
go test ./...

# Lint
golangci-lint run ./...
```

# Implementation Plan: Agent Skills SKILL.md

Epic: #18 Agent Skills 対応: repiq を標準スキルとして公開
Feature: SKILL.md 作成 + README 更新

## Dependency Graph

```
Phase 1: [#1 REFERENCE.md] ─── [#2 SKILL.md]
                                     │
Phase 2: [#3 README.md] ────────────┘
                                     │
Phase 3: [#4 Validate] ─────────────┘
```

Parallel: #1/#2 (別ファイル、依存なし)

## Tasks

- [ ] #1 Create REFERENCE.md (詳細出力スキーマ)
  What: 5 プロバイダーの全メトリクスフィールドを Markdown テーブルで記載
  Where: `skills/repiq/references/REFERENCE.md` (新規)
  How: `internal/provider/provider.go` の struct 定義から JSON タグ・型・説明を抽出してテーブル化
  Why: SKILL.md の progressive disclosure のため、詳細スキーマを分離
  Verify: 全 31 フィールド (GitHub 8 + npm 5 + PyPI 7 + crates 7 + Go 4) がテーブルに含まれること
  Files: `skills/repiq/references/REFERENCE.md`
  Depends: (none)

- [ ] #2 Create SKILL.md (メインスキルファイル)
  What: Agent Skills 仕様準拠の SKILL.md を作成。frontmatter + 8 セクション (Overview, Quick Start, Schemes, Flags, Use Cases, Auth, Installation, Output Reference)
  Where: `skills/repiq/SKILL.md` (新規)
  How: design.md の frontmatter 定義に従い、`internal/cli/cli.go` のフラグ定義と `README.md` の使用例を参照して作成
  Why: エージェントが repiq を発見・発動・実行するための指示書
  Verify: 500 行以内であること。frontmatter に name/description/license/compatibility/metadata が含まれること
  Files: `skills/repiq/SKILL.md`
  Depends: (none)

- [ ] #3 Update README.md (Agent Skills セクション追加)
  What: README.md の `## Output Formats` と `## Development` の間に `## Agent Skills` セクションを追加
  Where: `README.md` (既存ファイル編集)
  How: design.md の README 更新仕様に従い、インストールコマンドを記載
  Why: ユーザーが Agent Skills 対応を発見できるようにする
  Verify: README.md に `## Agent Skills` セクションが存在し、`npx skills add` コマンドが記載されていること
  Files: `README.md`
  Depends: #1, #2

- [ ] #4 Validate SKILL.md (skills-ref バリデーション)
  What: skills-ref validate を実行し、仕様準拠を確認
  Where: リポジトリルート
  How: `npx skills-ref validate ./skills/repiq` または Python skills-ref CLI で実行
  Why: Acceptance Gate: skills-ref validate 通過が必須条件
  Verify: コマンドが exit 0 で終了し、エラーなし
  Files: (なし — 読み取りのみ)
  Depends: #1, #2

Nix については、`skills-ref` は nixpkgs に含まれていませんが、npm パッケージ (`npx skills-ref`) として利用可能です。`agent-skills-nix` はスキルの**配布・インストール管理**用であり、バリデーションは `skills-ref` (npm) が担います。

file.content:
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

permissions:
  contents: read

jobs:
  ci:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 10
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@34e114876b0b11c390a56381ad16ebd13914f8d5 # v4.3.1
        with:
          persist-credentials: false

      - uses: actions/setup-go@40f1582b2485089dde7abd97c1529aa768e1baff # v5.6.0
        with:
          go-version: "1.24"

      - name: Check go mod tidy
        run: |
          go mod tidy
          git diff --exit-code go.mod go.sum

      - name: Go vet
        run: go vet ./...

      - name: golangci-lint
        uses: golangci/golangci-lint-action@55c2c1448f86e01eaae002a5a3a9624417608d84 # v6.5.2
        with:
          version: latest

      - name: Test
        run: go test ./... -v

      - name: Build
        run: go build ./cmd/repiq/

## Output Formats

- `--json` (default) -- Single JSON object or array
- `--ndjson` -- Newline-delimited JSON, one object per line
- `--markdown` -- Markdown table

## Agent Skills

repiq is available as an [Agent Skill](https://agentskills.io/) for AI coding agents (Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, etc.).

```bash
npx skills add github:yutakobayashidev/repiq
```

## Development

```bash
# Enter dev environment (requires Nix)
nix develop

# Run tests
go test ./...

# Lint
golangci-lint run ./...
```

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# repiq

Fetch objective metrics for OSS repositories. Built for AI agents that need fast, non-reasoning data retrieval for library/repository selection.

No judgments, no recommendations, no scores -- just numbers.

## Install

```
go install github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/cmd/repiq@latest
```

## Usage

```bash
# Single repo (JSON output by default)
repiq github:facebook/react

# npm package
repiq npm:react

# Scoped npm package
repiq npm:@types/node

# Python package (PyPI)
repiq pypi:requests

# Rust crate (crates.io)
repiq crates:serde

# Go module
repiq go:golang.org/x/text

# Multiple targets in NDJSON
repiq --ndjson github:facebook/react github:vuejs/core

# Mixed providers in Markdown table
repiq --markdown github:facebook/react npm:react pypi:flask crates:tokio go:golang.org/x/net

# Markdown table
repiq --markdown github:golang/go
```

## Supported Providers

| Provider   | Target format              |
| ---------- | -------------------------- |
| GitHub     | `github:<owner>/<repo>`    |
| npm        | `npm:<package>`            |
| PyPI       | `pypi:<package>`           |
| crates.io  | `crates:<crate>`           |
| Go Modules | `go:<module>`              |

## GitHub Metrics

| Metric              | Description                       |
| ------------------- | --------------------------------- |
| `stars`             | Star count                        |
| `forks`             | Fork count                        |
| `open_issues`       | Open issue count (includes PRs)   |
| `contributors`      | Number of contributors            |
| `release_count`     | Total releases                    |
| `last_commit_days`  | Days since last commit            |
| `commits_30d`       | Commits in the last 30 days       |
| `issues_closed_30d` | Issues closed in the last 30 days |

## npm Metrics

| Metric               | Description                        |
| -------------------- | ---------------------------------- |
| `weekly_downloads`   | Downloads in the last 7 days       |
| `latest_version`     | Latest published version           |
| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish            |
| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies     |
| `license`            | License identifier (e.g. MIT, ISC) |

## PyPI Metrics

| Metric               | Description                                 |
| -------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |
| `weekly_downloads`   | Downloads in the last 7 days                |
| `monthly_downloads`  | Downloads in the last 30 days               |
| `latest_version`     | Latest published version                    |
| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish                     |
| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies              |
| `license`            | License identifier                          |
| `requires_python`    | Python version requirement (e.g. `>=3.9`)   |

## crates.io Metrics

| Metric                  | Description                              |
| ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------- |
| `downloads`             | Total all-time downloads                 |
| `recent_downloads`      | Downloads in the last 90 days            |
| `latest_version`        | Latest stable version                    |
| `last_publish_days`     | Days since last publish                  |
| `dependencies_count`    | Number of normal dependencies            |
| `license`               | SPDX license identifier                  |
| `reverse_dependencies`  | Number of crates that depend on this one |

## Go Modules Metrics

| Metric               | Description                            |
| -------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
| `latest_version`     | Latest version tag                     |
| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish                |
| `dependencies_count` | Number of direct dependencies          |
| `license`            | License identifier (via deps.dev)      |

> Go does not provide public download count APIs. Use GitHub metrics for popularity signals.

## Authentication

Token resolution follows this priority (GitHub provider only):

1. `gh auth token` (GitHub CLI)
2. `GITHUB_TOKEN` environment variable
3. Unauthenticated (lower rate limits)

Other providers (npm, PyPI, crates.io, Go Modules) require no authentication.

## Output Formats

- `--json` (default) -- Single JSON object or array
- `--ndjson` -- Newline-delimited JSON, one object per line
- `--markdown` -- Markdown table

## Agent Skills

repiq is available as an [Agent Skill](https://agentskills.io/) for AI coding agents (Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, etc.).

```bash
npx skills add github:yutakobayashidev/repiq
```

## Development

```bash
# Enter dev environment (requires Nix)
nix develop

# Run tests
go test ./...

# Lint
golangci-lint run ./...
```

content.thinking:
The flake.nix doesn't have a `packages` or `apps` output, so `nix run github:yutakobayashidev/repiq` won't work. The SKILL.md mentions this as an installation option. I need to fix both SKILL.md and README.md to remove the broken `nix run` command.

The correct approach is to either:
1. Remove the `nix run` option from SKILL.md
2. Or add a `packages.default` to flake.nix

Since the epic scope says "no CLI changes", adding a packages output to flake.nix would be a separate concern. But it's a build config change, not a CLI change. 

I'll keep it simple and just remove the broken `nix run` command from the docs, sticking with `go install` as the documented approach. The flake.nix enhancement can be a follow-up.

file.content:
# Or use Nix flake
nix run github:yutakobayashidev/repiq
```

Verify installation:

```bash
repiq --version
```

## Caching

Results are cached on disk for 24 hours at `$XDG_CACHE_HOME/repiq/` (typically `~/.cache/repiq/`).

Use `--no-cache` to bypass cache reads (writes still occur for subsequent runs).

## Error Handling

- Failed targets return `{"target": "...", "error": "..."}` — other targets still succeed.
- Exit code is 1 if any target fails, 0 if all succeed.
- Common errors: 404 (not found), rate limit exceeded, network timeout (30s).

input.old_string:
```bash

---
name: repiq
description: >-
  Fetch objective metrics for OSS repositories and packages.
  Use when evaluating, comparing, or selecting libraries and repositories.
  Supports GitHub repos, npm/PyPI/crates.io packages, and Go modules.
  Returns stars, downloads, contributors, release activity, and more as structured JSON.
  No judgments, no recommendations, no scores — just numbers.
license: MIT
compatibility: Requires repiq CLI installed in PATH. Install via `go install` or Nix flake.
metadata:
  author: yutakobayashidev
  version: "1.0"
---

# repiq

Fetch objective metrics for OSS repositories and packages. Built for AI agents that need fast, non-reasoning data retrieval for library and repository evaluation.

**Role separation:** repiq provides raw data. You (the agent) do the reasoning. The human makes the final decision.

## Quick Start

```bash
# Fetch GitHub repo metrics
repiq github:facebook/react

# Fetch npm package metrics
repiq npm:react

# Compare multiple targets across providers
repiq --json github:facebook/react npm:react pypi:flask crates:serde go:golang.org/x/net
```

Output is JSON by default. Each target returns a structured result with provider-specific metrics.

## Supported Schemes

| Scheme | Format | Example |
|--------|--------|---------|
| GitHub | `github:<owner>/<repo>` | `github:facebook/react` |
| npm | `npm:<package>` | `npm:react`, `npm:@types/node` |
| PyPI | `pypi:<package>` | `pypi:requests` |
| crates.io | `crates:<crate>` | `crates:serde` |
| Go Modules | `go:<module/path>` | `go:golang.org/x/net` |

Multiple targets can be passed in a single command. They are fetched in parallel.

## Flags

| Flag | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `--json` | Output as JSON array (default) |
| `--ndjson` | Output as newline-delimited JSON (one object per line) |
| `--markdown` | Output as Markdown tables (grouped by provider) |
| `--no-cache` | Bypass 24-hour disk cache and always fetch from API |
| `--version` | Print version and exit |

## Key Metrics by Provider

**GitHub** (8 metrics): `stars`, `forks`, `open_issues`, `contributors`, `release_count`, `last_commit_days`, `commits_30d`, `issues_closed_30d`

**npm** (5 metrics): `weekly_downloads`, `latest_version`, `last_publish_days`, `dependencies_count`, `license`

**PyPI** (7 metrics): `weekly_downloads`, `monthly_downloads`, `latest_version`, `last_publish_days`, `dependencies_count`, `license`, `requires_python`

**crates.io** (7 metrics): `downloads`, `recent_downloads`, `latest_version`, `last_publish_days`, `dependencies_count`, `license`, `reverse_dependencies`

**Go Modules** (4 metrics): `latest_version`, `last_publish_days`, `dependencies_count`, `license`

For full field descriptions and types, see [references/REFERENCE.md](./references/REFERENCE.md).

## Use Cases

### Compare libraries for the same task

```bash
repiq --json github:expressjs/express github:fastify/fastify npm:express npm:fastify
```

Compare `stars`, `commits_30d`, `weekly_downloads`, and `last_publish_days` to assess activity and adoption.

### Evaluate repository health

```bash
repiq github:some-org/some-repo
```

Check `last_commit_days` (is it maintained?), `issues_closed_30d` (is the team responsive?), and `contributors` (bus factor).

### Cross-ecosystem package comparison

```bash
repiq npm:zod pypi:pydantic crates:serde
```

Compare equivalent packages across language ecosystems using `weekly_downloads`, `dependencies_count`, and `license`.

## Authentication

**GitHub only.** Token is resolved automatically:

1. `gh auth token` (GitHub CLI — recommended)
2. `GITHUB_TOKEN` environment variable
3. Unauthenticated (60 req/hour rate limit)

Authenticated requests get 5,000 req/hour. Other providers require no authentication.

## Installation

```bash
# Go install
go install github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/cmd/repiq@latest

# Or use Nix flake
nix run github:yutakobayashidev/repiq
```

Verify installation:

```bash
repiq --version
```

## Caching

Results are cached on disk for 24 hours at `$XDG_CACHE_HOME/repiq/` (typically `~/.cache/repiq/`).

Use `--no-cache` to bypass cache reads (writes still occur for subsequent runs).

## Error Handling

- Failed targets return `{"target": "...", "error": "..."}` — other targets still succeed.
- Exit code is 1 if any target fails, 0 if all succeed.
- Common errors: 404 (not found), rate limit exceeded, network timeout (30s).

content.content:
1→# CLAUDE.md
     2→
     3→This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
     4→
     5→## Commands
     6→
     7→```bash
     8→# システム設定を反映（NixOS / macOS 共通）
     9→nix run .#switch
    10→
    11→# ビルドのみ（適用なし）
    12→nix run .#build
    13→
    14→# 特定のパッケージを検索
    15→nix search nixpkgs <package>
    16→
    17→# flake入力を更新
    18→nix flake update
    19→```
    20→
    21→## Agent Skills
    22→
    23→このリポジトリは`agent-skills-nix`でスキルを管理しています。
    24→
    25→- **設定**: `nix/modules/home/agent-skills.nix`
    26→- **ローカルスキル**: `agents/skills/`
    27→- **外部スキル**: `anthropics/skills`, `vercel-labs/skills`
    28→- **デプロイ先**: `~/.agents/skills`, `~/.config/claude/skills`
    29→
    30→主なスキル：
    31→- `social-digest` - Discord + Mastodon投稿をObsidianに保存（ローカル）
    32→- `oura-daily-watch` - Oura Ring データ + Discord行動分析（ローカル）
    33→- `check-similarity` - TypeScript/JavaScript重複コード検知（ローカル）
    34→- `dce` - Dead Code Elimination（ローカル）
    35→- `docx`, `pdf`, `pptx`, `xlsx` - ドキュメント処理（Anthropic）
    36→- `frontend-design`, `skill-creator`, `webapp-testing` - 開発支援（Anthropic）
    37→- `find-skills` - スキル検索・発見支援（Vercel）
    38→- `ui-ux-pro-max` - UI/UXデザインシステム生成（コミュニティ）
    39→- `obsidian-markdown`, `obsidian-bases`, `json-canvas`, `obsidian-cli`, `defuddle` - Obsidian連携（kepano）
    40→
    41→詳細: `agents/README.md`
    42→
    43→## Architecture
    44→

1→# dotnix
     2→
     3→[![DeepWiki](https://img.shields.io/badge/DeepWiki-yutakobayashidev%2Fdotnix-blue.svg?logo=data:image/png;base64,REDACTED)](https://deepwiki.com/yutakobayashidev/dotnix)
     4→

     6→
     7→| Machine | Name | OS | System | Stable |
     8→|---|---|---|---|---|
     9→| UM790 Pro | UM790-Pro | NixOS | x86_64-linux | ◎ |
    10→| Still Legend x870 | Still-Legend-x870 | NixOS (WSL) | x86_64-linux | △ |
    11→| M2 MacBook Air | M2-MacBook-Air | macOS | aarch64-darwin | ◎ |
    12→| Galaxy S23 FE | Galaxy-S23FE | Android (nix-on-droid) | aarch64-linux | △ |
    13→
    14→
    15→## Module Structure
    16→
    17→```
    18→flake.nix                    # Entry point (nixos + darwin + nixOnDroid Configurations)
    19→├── nix/
    20→│   ├── hosts/
    21→│   │   ├── UM790-Pro/           # NixOS host config (boot, network, locale)
    22→│   │   ├── Still-Legend-x870/   # NixOS-WSL host config (WSL, locale)
    23→│   │   ├── M2-MacBook-Air/      # macOS host config
    24→│   │   └── Galaxy-S23FE/        # nix-on-droid host config
    25→│   ├── profiles/
    26→│   │   ├── cli-minimal.nix  # Minimal CLI environment
    27→│   │   ├── cli.nix          # CLI environment (docker, tailscale)
    28→│   │   ├── cli-server.nix   # Server CLI environment (docker, no tailscale)
    29→│   │   ├── gui.nix          # GUI environment (niri, audio, bluetooth)
    30→│   │   ├── laptop.nix       # Laptop environment (gui + extras)
    31→│   │   └── darwin.nix       # macOS environment
    32→│   ├── modules/
    33→│   │   ├── linux/           # NixOS system modules (niri, docker, audio, etc.)
    34→│   │   ├── darwin/          # macOS nix-darwin modules (homebrew, system defaults, nix)
    35→│   │   ├── nix-on-droid/    # nix-on-droid shared modules
    36→│   │   └── home/            # Home Manager shared modules (zsh, git, claude-code)
    37→│   └── overlays/            # Custom packages (overlay)
    38→├── agents/skills/           # Claude Code agent skills
    39→├── nvim/                    # Neovim config (Lua)
    40→└── zsh/                     # Zsh config
    41→```
    42→
    43→## Documentation
    44→
    45→- [docs/UM790Pro.md](docs/UM790Pro.md) - NixOS installation guide
    46→- [docs/Still-Legend-x870.md](docs/Still-Legend-x870.md) - NixOS-WSL installation guide
    47→- [docs/M2-MacBook-Air.md](docs/M2-MacBook-Air.md) - nix-darwin installation guide for macOS
    48→- [docs/Galaxy-S23FE.md](docs/Galaxy-S23FE.md) - nix-on-droid installation guide for Android
    49→
    50→## Daily Usage
    51→
    52→```sh
    53→# Apply changes (NixOS or macOS)
    54→nix run .#switch
    55→
    56→# Build without applying
    57→nix run .#build
    58→
    59→# Format all files (nix, lua, sh)
    60→nix run .#fmt
    61→
    62→# Update flake inputs
    63→nix flake update
    64→```
    65→
    66→## Available Nix Apps
    67→
    68→### NixOS
    69→
    70→- `nix run .#switch` - Build and apply NixOS + Home Manager configuration (`sudo nixos-rebuild switch`)
    71→- `nix run .#build` - Build configuration without applying
    72→- `nix run .#fmt` - Format all files (nix, lua, sh) via [treefmt](https://github.com/numtide/treefmt-nix)
    73→
    74→### macOS
    75→
    76→- `nix run .#switch` - Build and apply nix-darwin + Home Manager configuration (`darwin-rebuild switch`)
    77→- `nix run .#build` - Build configuration without applying
    78→- `nix run .#fmt` - Format all files (nix, lua, sh) via [treefmt](https://github.com/numtide/treefmt-nix)
    79→
    80→Both use [nix-output-monitor](https://github.com/maralorn/nix-output-monitor) for build output.
    81→
    82→## Key Features
    83→
    84→### NixOS
    85→
    86→- **WM**: [Niri](https://github.com/YaLTeR/niri) (scrollable tiling Wayland compositor)
    87→- **IME**: fcitx5 + [hazkey](https://github.com/aster-void/nix-hazkey) (LLM-powered Japanese input)
    88→- **YubiKey**: PAM U2F authentication (polkit, swaylock)
    89→- **Development**: Docker, Tailscale, Android development environment
    90→
    91→### macOS
    92→
    93→- **Homebrew**: GUI app management via casks (Ghostty, Chrome, OrbStack, etc.)
    94→- **brew-nix**: Homebrew cask packages managed as Nix packages (version pinning & rollback)
    95→- **Touch ID**: sudo authentication support
    96→- **1Password**: Shell Plugins (gh, awscli2)
    97→
    98→## Managed Tools
    99→
   100→- **AI Development**: claude-code, codex, opencode, ccusage, vibe-kanban

1→# Agent Skills

     6→
     7→スキルは`agent-skills-nix`フレームワークで管理されています。
     8→

    10→- **ローカルスキル**: `agents/skills/`
    11→- **デプロイ先**:

    16→
    17→1. `agents/skills/<skill-name>/`ディレクトリを作成
    18→2. `SKILL.md`ファイルを作成
    19→3. `nh os switch`で反映
    20→
    21→## 利用可能なスキル
    22→
    23→### ローカルスキル
    24→
    25→- `social-digest` - Discord + Mastodon投稿をObsidianに保存
    26→- `oura-daily-watch` - Oura Ring データ + Discord行動分析

    30→#### ドキュメントスキル

    32→- `pdf` - PDF作成・抽出
    33→- `pptx` - PowerPoint作成・編集

    39→- `webapp-testing` - Webアプリテスト（Playwright）

    44→### Vercel公式スキル

    46→- `find-skills` - スキル検索・発見支援

    48→その他のVercelスキルは`nix/modules/home/agent-skills.nix`で追加可能です。

    51→### Obsidianスキル

    60→
    61→### コミュニティスキル

content.text: 最終 diff を確認します。

変更は4ファイル:

| ファイル | 変更内容 |
|---------|---------|
| `flake.nix` | `repiq` を flake input として追加 + overlay に `_repiq` パススルー |
| `nix/overlays/dev-tools.nix` | `repiq = prev._repiq.packages.${system}.default` 追加 |
| `nix/modules/home/packages.nix` | `repiq` を共通パッケージリストに追加 |
| `nix/modules/home/agent-skills.nix` | skills source + enableAll に `repiq` 追加 |

repiq PR #20 がマージされてから dotnix 側をコミット・push してください。`packages.default` が main に入る前だと `flake lock` 更新時にビルドが通りません。

message.content: repiq、マージはしたんですが、まだプライベートリポジトリなので、公開に向けて必要そうなのをまとめて

content.content:
1→# repiq
     2→
     3→Fetch objective metrics for OSS repositories. Built for AI agents that need fast, non-reasoning data retrieval for library/repository selection.
     4→
     5→No judgments, no recommendations, no scores -- just numbers.
     6→
     7→## Install
     8→
     9→```
    10→go install github.com/yutakobayashidev/repiq/cmd/repiq@latest
    11→```
    12→
    13→## Usage
    14→
    15→```bash
    16→# Single repo (JSON output by default)
    17→repiq github:facebook/react
    18→
    19→# npm package
    20→repiq npm:react
    21→
    22→# Scoped npm package
    23→repiq npm:@types/node
    24→
    25→# Python package (PyPI)
    26→repiq pypi:requests
    27→
    28→# Rust crate (crates.io)
    29→repiq crates:serde
    30→
    31→# Go module
    32→repiq go:golang.org/x/text
    33→
    34→# Multiple targets in NDJSON
    35→repiq --ndjson github:facebook/react github:vuejs/core
    36→
    37→# Mixed providers in Markdown table
    38→repiq --markdown github:facebook/react npm:react pypi:flask crates:tokio go:golang.org/x/net
    39→
    40→# Markdown table
    41→repiq --markdown github:golang/go
    42→```
    43→
    44→## Supported Providers
    45→
    46→| Provider   | Target format              |
    47→| ---------- | -------------------------- |
    48→| GitHub     | `github:<owner>/<repo>`    |
    49→| npm        | `npm:<package>`            |
    50→| PyPI       | `pypi:<package>`           |
    51→| crates.io  | `crates:<crate>`           |
    52→| Go Modules | `go:<module>`              |
    53→
    54→## GitHub Metrics
    55→
    56→| Metric              | Description                       |
    57→| ------------------- | --------------------------------- |
    58→| `stars`             | Star count                        |
    59→| `forks`             | Fork count                        |
    60→| `open_issues`       | Open issue count (includes PRs)   |
    61→| `contributors`      | Number of contributors            |
    62→| `release_count`     | Total releases                    |
    63→| `last_commit_days`  | Days since last commit            |
    64→| `commits_30d`       | Commits in the last 30 days       |
    65→| `issues_closed_30d` | Issues closed in the last 30 days |
    66→
    67→## npm Metrics
    68→
    69→| Metric               | Description                        |
    70→| -------------------- | ---------------------------------- |
    71→| `weekly_downloads`   | Downloads in the last 7 days       |
    72→| `latest_version`     | Latest published version           |
    73→| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish            |
    74→| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies     |
    75→| `license`            | License identifier (e.g. MIT, ISC) |
    76→
    77→## PyPI Metrics
    78→
    79→| Metric               | Description                                 |
    80→| -------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |
    81→| `weekly_downloads`   | Downloads in the last 7 days                |
    82→| `monthly_downloads`  | Downloads in the last 30 days               |
    83→| `latest_version`     | Latest published version                    |
    84→| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish                     |
    85→| `dependencies_count` | Number of runtime dependencies              |
    86→| `license`            | License identifier                          |
    87→| `requires_python`    | Python version requirement (e.g. `>=3.9`)   |
    88→
    89→## crates.io Metrics
    90→
    91→| Metric                  | Description                              |
    92→| ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------- |
    93→| `downloads`             | Total all-time downloads                 |
    94→| `recent_downloads`      | Downloads in the last 90 days            |
    95→| `latest_version`        | Latest stable version                    |
    96→| `last_publish_days`     | Days since last publish                  |
    97→| `dependencies_count`    | Number of normal dependencies            |
    98→| `license`               | SPDX license identifier                  |
    99→| `reverse_dependencies`  | Number of crates that depend on this one |
   100→
   101→## Go Modules Metrics
   102→
   103→| Metric               | Description                            |
   104→| -------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
   105→| `latest_version`     | Latest version tag                     |
   106→| `last_publish_days`  | Days since last publish                |
   107→| `dependencies_count` | Number of direct dependencies          |
   108→| `license`            | License identifier (via deps.dev)      |
   109→
   110→> Go does not provide public download count APIs. Use GitHub metrics for popularity signals.
   111→
   112→## Authentication
   113→
   114→Token resolution follows this priority (GitHub provider only):
   115→
   116→1. `gh auth token` (GitHub CLI)
   117→2. `GITHUB_TOKEN` environment variable
   118→3. Unauthenticated (lower rate limits)
   119→
   120→Other providers (npm, PyPI, crates.io, Go Modules) require no authentication.
   121→
   122→## Output Formats
   123→
   124→- `--json` (default) -- Single JSON object or array
   125→- `--ndjson` -- Newline-delimited JSON, one object per line
   126→- `--markdown` -- Markdown table
   127→
   128→## Development
   129→
   130→```bash
   131→# Enter dev environment (requires Nix)
   132→nix develop
   133→
   134→# Run tests
   135→go test ./...
   136→
   137→# Lint
   138→golangci-lint run ./...
   139→```
   140→

content.content:
1→# Agent Guidelines for repiq
     2→
     3→## Commit Message Convention
     4→
     5→Follow [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/) with **required scope**.
     6→
     7→Format: `<type>(<scope>): <description>`
     8→
     9→### Types
    10→
    11→- `feat` - New feature
    12→- `fix` - Bug fix
    13→- `docs` - Documentation changes
    14→- `build` - Build system, dependencies, Nix flake
    15→- `chore` - Maintenance tasks
    16→- `ci` - CI/CD configuration
    17→- `refactor` - Code restructuring without behavior change
    18→- `test` - Adding or updating tests
    19→- `perf` - Performance improvements
    20→- `style` - Code style (formatting, semicolons, etc.)
    21→- `revert` - Reverting a previous commit
    22→
    23→### Scope
    24→
    25→Scope is **mandatory**. Use the most relevant area:
    26→
    27→- `cli` - CLI entry point, argument parsing, output formatting
    28→- `provider` - Provider interface, shared provider logic
    29→- `github` - GitHub provider
    30→- `npm` - npm provider
    31→- `pypi` - PyPI provider
    32→- `crates` - crates.io provider
    33→- `go` - Go Modules provider
    34→- `specs` - Spec documents under docs/specs/
    35→- `nix` - Nix flake, dev environment
    36→- `deps` - Dependency updates
    37→
    38→### Examples
    39→
    40→```
    41→feat(cli): add --markdown output format
    42→fix(github): handle rate limit errors gracefully
    43→docs(specs): add core epic scope document
    44→build(nix): add gitleaks pre-commit hook
    45→test(provider): add unit tests for target parsing
    46→refactor(cli): extract output formatter into separate package
    47→```
    48→
    49→### PR Titles
    50→
    51→PR titles **must** follow the same convention. Squash merges use the PR title as the commit message.
    52→
    53→```
    54→docs(specs): add CLI + GitHub provider feature spec
    55→feat(github): implement GitHub provider with metrics fetching
    56→```
    57→
    58→### Bad Examples
    59→
    60→```
    61→feat: add markdown output        # missing scope
    62→update code                      # missing type and scope
    63→fix(github): Fix bug.            # don't capitalize, don't end with period
    64→Core: CLI + GitHub プロバイダー  # PR title not following convention
    65→```
    66→
    67→## External API Rules
    68→
    69→Before using any external API endpoint in implementation:
    70→
    71→1. Verify the endpoint exists with `curl` — don't assume based on naming conventions or docs from other APIs
    72→2. Check the actual response shape with a real request before writing structs or mocks
    73→3. Test mocks only prove the code works against themselves, not against the real API — always manual-test after implementation
    74→
    75→Example mistake: deps.dev Go packages use `:requirements` (not `:dependencies`). The response format also differs completely from what the endpoint name implies.
    76→
